# UIPrintInfo

**Class**

Information about a print job that the system uses when it prints.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIPrintInfo
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo] object encapsulates information about a print job, including printer identifier, job name, output type (photo, normal, grayscale), orientation (portrait or landscape), and any selected duplex mode.

Typically, you create a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo] object and assign it to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/printInfo] property of the shared [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] instance. However, it isn’t necessary to create a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo] object for a print job; UIKit assumes certain defaults. In the printing-options user interface, users can select the printer, single-sided or double-sided printing for duplex printers, and (if the app allows it) a range of pages to print.

## Creating a print info object

- **printInfo()**: Returns a print-information object initialized with default values.
- **init(dictionary:)**: Returns a print-information object that is initialized with the data in the passed-in dictionary.
- **dictionaryRepresentation**: A dictionary representation of a print-information object.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates a print info object from data in an unarchiver.

## Managing print-job attributes

- **duplex**: The duplex mode to use for the print job.
- **UIPrintInfo.Duplex**: Constants that describe the duplex mode of a selected printer.
- **jobName**: The name of the print job.
- **orientation**: The orientation of the printed content, portrait or landscape.
- **UIPrintInfo.Orientation**: Constants that describe the orientation of printing on a page.
- **outputType**: The kind of printable content.
- **UIPrintInfo.OutputType**: Constants that describe the output type, which is an indication of the type of content the app is drawing or providing.
- **printerID**: An identifier of the printer to use for the print job.

## Job info

- **UIPrinter**: A printer on the network.
- **UIPrintPaper**: The size of paper for a print job and the rectangular area that the content prints within.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
